intro: Centaurea pelia, commonly known as the purple centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea pelia is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
